analyzed: lo brgya sum cu rtsa bdun lon pa na rgyal po dga' bo dang padma chen po zhes bya bas grong khyer pa ta li pu tra'i nang du sdud par byed pa la sogs pa'i 'phags pa phal ni yang len pa med par bsil ba'i dngos po thob par
translated: When he was one hundred thirty-seven years old, King Nanda and Mahāpadma caused a great schism in the city of Pāṭaliputra.🔽When the majority of the noble Saṅgha, such as the compilers, attained the state of coolness without taking another rebirth, the noble Mahākāśyapa, the noble Mahāloma, Mahātyāga, Guru, Revanta, and so on, who were arhats who had attained the correct discriminations, were still present.

original: gyur pa na 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po dang / 'phags pa spu chen po dang / gtong ba chen po dang / bla ma dang / re ba ta la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa'i dgra bcom pa'i dge 'dun de ltar bzhugs pa na bdud sdig to can bzang po thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa /

translated: At that time, the evil Māra, who is the adversary of all that is good,

analyzed: dge slong gi cha byad 'dzin pas rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs bstan nas /
translated: displayed various miracles while wearing the attire of a bhikṣu.

analyzed: gzhi lngas dge 'dun gyi dbyen chen po bskyed de /
translated: He created a great schism in the Saṅgha by means of five bases.

analyzed: gnas brtan klu zhes bya ba dang / yid brtan pa zhes bya ba mang du thos pa dag gi gzhi lnga bsngags par byed / rjes su ston par byed cing de gzhan la lan gdab pa dang / mi shes pa dang / yid gnyis dang / yongs su brtags pa dang / bdag @149a * //
translated: The elders Nāga and Śākyamitra, who were very learned, praised the five bases.

original: nyid gso bar byed pa ni lam yin te /
analyzed: nyid gso bar byed pa ni lam yin te /
translated: They taught that the path is to respond to others, to be ignorant, to be doubtful, to be speculative, and to be self-sufficient.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin no zhes zar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yin no zhes zar ro //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: de nas sde pa gnyis su chad nas gnas te /
analyzed: de nas sde pa gnyis su chad nas gnas te /
translated: Then the community split into two factions.

original: gnas brtan pa dang / dge 'dun phal chen sde zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan pa dang / dge 'dun phal chen sde zhes bya'o //
translated: The elders became known as the Sthaviras, and the majority of the community became known as the Mahāsāṃghikas.

original: de ltar lo drug cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du dge 'dun bye nas 'khrug long gis gnas so //
analyzed: de ltar lo drug cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du dge 'dun bye nas 'khrug long gis gnas so //
translated: Thus the community remained divided and in turmoil for sixty-three years.

original: de nas lo brgya phrag gnyis 'das pa'i rjes la gnas brtan gnas ma'i bus bstan pa yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: de nas lo brgya phrag gnyis 'das pa'i rjes la gnas brtan gnas ma'i bus bstan pa yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: Then, two hundred years later, the elder Vṛjiputra gathered the community together.

original: des yang dag par bsdus pa na dge 'dun phal chen pa yang rnam pa gnyis su byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: des yang dag par bsdus pa na dge 'dun phal chen pa yang rnam pa gnyis su byung bar gyur te /
translated: When they were collected, the Mahāsāṃghika also became divided into two groups.

original: tha snyad gcig pa dang / ba lang gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha snyad gcig pa dang / ba lang gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Ekavyāvahārika and the Gokulika.

original: de la tha snyad gcig pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi rtsa ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de la tha snyad gcig pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi rtsa ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The root of the discipline of the Ekavyāvahārika is this: The Bhagavān Buddhas are supramundane.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi chos ni mi mnga'o /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi chos ni mi mnga'o /
translated: The Tathāgata does not have mundane qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rjes su gsung ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rjes su gsung ni mi 'jug go //
translated: The Tathāgata does not turn the wheel of Dharma in accordance with the speech of all the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni snying po la mngon par mos pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung ni snying po la mngon par mos pa'o //
translated: The speech of all the tathāgatas is the essence of aspiration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas der gzugs nye bar len pa ni mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la gnas der gzugs nye bar len pa ni mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathāgata does not have the appropriation of form in that place.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dus na nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / ltar ltar pos 'jug ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dus na nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / ltar ltar pos 'jug ba ma yin te /
translated: When he was a bodhisattva, he did not enter through the stages of kalala, arbuda, and peśin.

original: glang po cher gyur nas yum gyi dku nas zhugs nas rang nyid nges par 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: glang po cher gyur nas yum gyi dku nas zhugs nas rang nyid nges par 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Having become an elephant, he entered his mother’s womb and then left it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod pa'i 'du shes ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la 'dod pa'i 'du shes ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: But the Bodhisattvas have no notion of desire.

original: ngan 'gro rnams su bdag nyid kyi 'dod pas skye ba blangs te sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams su bdag nyid kyi 'dod pas skye ba blangs te sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: By their own desire, they take birth in the evil destinies in order to mature living beings.

original: ye shes gcig gis bden pa bzhi rnams yongs su shes so //
analyzed: ye shes gcig gis bden pa bzhi rnams yongs su shes so //
translated: By a single knowledge, they know the four noble truths.

original: rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug po dag ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no //
translated: The six consciousnesses are sometimes with attachment, sometimes without attachment.

original: mig gis ni gzugs rnams mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gis ni gzugs rnams mthong ngo //
translated: The eye sees forms.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang gzhan dag gis bstan pa sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyang gzhan dag gis bstan pa sgrub par byed do //
translated: The Arhats also realize what is taught by others.

original: mi shes pa dang / yid gnyis dang / yongs su brtags pa dang / sdug bsngal spong ba'i lam yang yod do //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / yid gnyis dang / yongs su brtags pa dang / sdug bsngal spong ba'i lam yang yod do //
translated: There is a path for the abandonment of ignorance, doubt, and wrong views, and of suffering.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe ngag 'jug pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshe ngag 'jug pa yang yod do //
translated: There is speech in one who is concentrated.

original: mi gtsang ba spangs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba spangs pa yang yod do //
translated: There is the abandonment of impurity.

original: yang dag par sdom pa mngon du byas pa nyid kyis kun du sbyor ba thams cad rab tu spangs par brjod @149b bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sdom pa mngon du byas pa nyid kyis kun du sbyor ba thams cad rab tu spangs par brjod @149b bar bya'o //
translated: By the practice of perfect restraint, one should say that all the fetters are abandoned.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag par lta ba ni mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la 'jig rten pa'i yang dag par lta ba ni mi mnga'o //
translated: The Tathagatas do not have mundane right views.

original: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin bas bag la nyal ba rnams sems dang mtshungs par ldan zhe'am /
analyzed: sems ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin bas bag la nyal ba rnams sems dang mtshungs par ldan zhe'am /
translated: Since the mind is luminous by nature, one should not say that the latent tendencies are associated with the mind,

original: mi ldan zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi ldan zhes brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: or that they are not associated.

original: bag la nyal ba yang gzhan la /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba yang gzhan la /
translated: The latent tendencies are one thing,

original: kun nas ldang ba yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba yang gzhan yin no //
translated: and the manifest afflictions are another.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
translated: The past and future do not exist.🔽The stream-enterer attains the dhyanas.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ste de lta bu rnams ni tha snyad gcig pa rnams kyi dam tshig yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa yin no zhes bya ba ste de lta bu rnams ni tha snyad gcig pa rnams kyi dam tshig yin no //
translated: Such are the commitments of those who use the same terminology.

original: yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi dbye ba ni mang du thos pa dang btags par smra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi dbye ba ni mang du thos pa dang btags par smra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The Vaibhashikas have many divisions, such as the Sthaviras and the Mahaashramiga.

original: de la mang du thos pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam la ni rnam par dpyod pa med do //
analyzed: de la mang du thos pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam la ni rnam par dpyod pa med do //
translated: There is no analysis on the path of renunciation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa ni bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of suffering, the conventional truth, and the noble truth are true.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rnams mthong bas yang dag par skyon med pa la 'jug gi / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal mthong bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rnams mthong bas yang dag par skyon med pa la 'jug gi / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal mthong bas ni ma yin no //
translated: One enters into the faultless state by seeing the suffering of conditioned existence, not by seeing the suffering of suffering and the suffering of change.

original: dge 'dun ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The Sangha is supramundane.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams la yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa bsgrub pa yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams la yang gzhan gyis nye bar bstan pa bsgrub pa yod do //
translated: Even for arhats, there is the accomplishment of what is taught by others.

original: yang dag par bsgrags pa'i lam yang yod do //
analyzed: yang dag par bsgrags pa'i lam yang yod do //
translated: There is the path of correct proclamation.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la yang dag par 'jug pa yod do zhes bya ba rnams ni mang du thos pa rnams kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la yang dag par 'jug pa yod do zhes bya ba rnams ni mang du thos pa rnams kyi dam tshig go //
translated: There is correct engagement in equipoise. These are the commitments of the learned.

original: yang btags par smra ba rnams kyi phung po med pa'i sdug bsngal yang yod do //
analyzed: yang btags par smra ba rnams kyi phung po med pa'i sdug bsngal yang yod do //
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas say that there is suffering without aggregates.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i skye mched kyang yod do //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i skye mched kyang yod do //
translated: They say that there is a sense base that is not completely formed.

original: 'du byed rnams ni phan tshun brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni phan tshun brtags pa yin no //
translated: They say that formations are mutually imputed.

original: yang sdug bsngal ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: yang sdug bsngal ni don dam par ro //
translated: They say that suffering is ultimate.

original: sems las byung ba ni lam ma yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni lam ma yin no //
translated: They say that mental factors are not the path.

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni med do //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni med do //
translated: They say that untimely death does not exist.

original: skyes bu byed pa yang med do //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa yang med do //
translated: They say that there is no human effort.🔽They say that all suffering arises from karma.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ni las las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni btags par smra ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no //🔽yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi bye brag las gnas brtan mchod rten pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ni las las byung ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ni btags par smra ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no // yang ba lang gnas pa rnams kyi bye brag las gnas brtan mchod rten pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Such are the root tenets of the Vātsīputrīyas.🔽The Sthavira Pūrvārāmavasins are a subdivision of the Vātsīputrīyas.

original: de ni lha chen po zhes bya ba'i kun du rgyu zhig rab tu byung nas mchod rten can gyi ril gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni lha chen po zhes bya ba'i kun du rgyu zhig rab tu byung nas mchod rten can gyi ril gnas pa yin te /
translated: They are called the Mahādeva school because they are followers of a renunciate named Mahādeva who lived in a temple.

original: yang de ni dge 'dun phal chen pa'i gzhi 'don par gyur pa na mchod rten pa zhes bya ba'i sde par rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: yang de ni dge 'dun phal chen pa'i gzhi 'don par gyur pa na mchod rten pa zhes bya ba'i sde par rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Again, when the Mahāsāṃghika split, the Caityaśailas were established as a sect.

original: de dag ni dge 'dun phal chen pa rnams kyi sde pa drug tu bzhag pa yin no //🔽yang gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa @150a * //
analyzed: de dag ni dge 'dun phal chen pa rnams kyi sde pa drug tu bzhag pa yin no // yang gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa @150a * //
translated: These are the six sects of the Mahāsāṃghika.🔽Again, the Sthavira also split into two sects:

original: gnyis te / sngar gyi gnas brtan pa dang / gangs ri pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis te / sngar gyi gnas brtan pa dang / gangs ri pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the original Sthavira and the Haimavata.

analyzed: sngar gyi gnas brtan pa'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni dgra bcom pa rnams la gzhan gyis ston cing bsgrub pa ni med do //
translated: The root tenets of the original Sthviras are as follows: Arhats are not taught and established by others.

original: de bzhin du gzhi lnga po yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhi lnga po yang med do //
translated: Similarly, the five bases do not exist.

original: gang zag ni yod do //
analyzed: gang zag ni yod do //
translated: The person exists.

original: srid pa bar ma ni yod do ;
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni yod do ;
translated: The intermediate existence exists.

original: / dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das ba ni yod do //
analyzed: / dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das ba ni yod do //
translated: The parinirvāṇa of arhats exists.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
translated: The past and future exist.🔽The meaning of nirvāṇa exists.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don ni yod do zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan pa'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i don ni yod do zhes bya ba ni gnas brtan pa'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig go //
translated: These are the root tenets of the Sthavira.

analyzed: de la gangs ri ba'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni byang chub sems dpa' ni so so'i skye bo ma yin zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is not an ordinary person.

original: phyi rol pa la yang mngon par shes pa lnga ni yod do //
analyzed: phyi rol pa la yang mngon par shes pa lnga ni yod do //
translated: The five superknowledges exist even for the heterodox.

original: phung po las gang zag ni gzhan yin par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phung po las gang zag ni gzhan yin par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The person should be described as other than the aggregates,

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba na gang du phung po 'gags pa na gang zag ni gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when one attains nirvana, the person remains when the aggregates cease.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa la ngag 'jug pa ni yod do //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa la ngag 'jug pa ni yod do //
translated: Speech exists in equipoise.🔽The path abandons the suffering of the path.

original: lam gyi sdug bsngal spong ngo zhes bya ba de dag ni gangs ri pa'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: lam gyi sdug bsngal spong ngo zhes bya ba de dag ni gangs ri pa'i dam tshig go //
translated: These are the assertions of the Himavatas.

original: yang dang po'i gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su gyur te /
analyzed: yang dang po'i gnas brtan pa yang rnam pa gnyis su gyur te /
translated: The Sthaviras also split into two:

original: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / gnas ma'i bu'i zhes bya'o //🔽de la thams cad yod par smra ba'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni gnyis kyis thams cad bsdus te /
analyzed: thams cad yod par smra ba dang / gnas ma'i bu'i zhes bya'o // de la thams cad yod par smra ba'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni gnyis kyis thams cad bsdus te /
translated: the Sarvastivadins and the Vatsiputriyas.🔽The fundamental assertions of the Sarvastivadins are:

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: All is included in the two, the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de skad smras pas cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de skad smras pas cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the point of saying that?

original: gang zag ni med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag ni med ces bya ba ste /
translated: The person does not exist.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag med pa yi lus 'di 'byung ba na //
analyzed: bdag med pa yi lus 'di 'byung ba na //
translated: This body, which is without a self, arises

original: byed pa med cing rig pa po yang med //
analyzed: byed pa med cing rig pa po yang med //
translated: without an agent and without an experiencer.

original: ji ltar 'khor ba'i chu klung 'jug 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khor ba'i chu klung 'jug 'gyur ba //
translated: How does it enter the river of cyclic existence?

analyzed: nyan pa'i mchog khyod de ni bstan gyis nyon // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Listen, O best of listeners, I will teach you.

original: de dag ni thams cad yod par smra ba'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni thams cad yod par smra ba'i rtsa ba'i dam tshig go //
translated: These are the root vows of the Sarvāstivādins.

original: yang de dag gi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni ming dang gzugs kyis thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: yang de dag gi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni ming dang gzugs kyis thams cad bsdus so //
translated: Their root vows are all included in name and form.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ni yod do //
translated: The past and future exist.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni mi nyams pa'i chos can yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni mi nyams pa'i chos can yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say that a stream enterer is one who does not regress.

original: 'dus byas rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni gsum yin no //
translated: The characteristics of conditioned states are three.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ni rim gyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One realizes the four noble truths in sequence.

analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dag gis skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: They enter into the faultless state through emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: skad cig ma bcom lngas ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma bcom lngas ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: By means of the five moments of destruction, one enters into the fruit of stream-entry.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa yin no //
translated: The stream-enterer has attained the meditative absorptions.

original: dgra bcom @150b pa yang nyams pa srid do //
analyzed: dgra bcom @150b pa yang nyams pa srid do //
translated: It is possible that even the arhat may fall away.

analyzed: phyi rol ba la yang mngon par shes pa lnga yod do //

analyzed: lha rnams la yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yod do //

analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ni yod do //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang ma yin /

analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag ni thams cad yod par smra ba'i dam tshig go //

original: yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i bye brag ni rnam par phye ste smra ba yin no //
analyzed: yang thams cad yod par smra ba'i bye brag ni rnam par phye ste smra ba yin no //
translated: The Sarvāstivādins are divided into the Vibhajyavādins.

analyzed: yang rnam par phye ste smra ba'i bye brag ni mang ston pa dang / chos sbas pa dang / gos dmar ba dang / 'od srungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Vibhajyavādins are divided into the Mahīśāsakas, the Dharmaguptakas, the Tāmraśāṭīyas, and the Kāśyapīyas.

analyzed: de la mang ston pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa ni med do //
translated: The Mahīśāsakas maintain the following principles: The past and the future do not exist.

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'dus byas nyid ni yod do //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'dus byas nyid ni yod do //
translated: Only the present conditioned factors exist.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas bden pa bzhi char mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas bden pa bzhi char mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One sees the four noble truths by seeing the truth of unsatisfactoriness.

original: bag la nyal yang gzhan yin la mngon du rgyu yang gzhan yin no //
analyzed: bag la nyal yang gzhan yin la mngon du rgyu yang gzhan yin no //
translated: The latent proclivities are distinct from manifest activity.

original: srid pa bar ma ni med do //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni med do //
translated: There is no intermediate existence.

original: lha'i gnas na yang tshangs par spyod pa ni yod do //
analyzed: lha'i gnas na yang tshangs par spyod pa ni yod do //
translated: There is pure conduct in the heavens.

original: dgra bcom pa yang bsod nams bsog go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yang bsod nams bsog go //
translated: The perfected being can accumulate merit.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yod do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yod do //
translated: The five aggregates of consciousness are sometimes associated with attachment and sometimes disassociated from attachment.

original: gang zag ni mgo la sogs pa lus dang mnyam po yin no //
analyzed: gang zag ni mgo la sogs pa lus dang mnyam po yin no //
translated: The person is the same as the body, the head, etc.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bsam gtan thob pa'o //
translated: The stream-winner is one who has attained the dhyānas.

original: so so'i skye bos kyang 'dod chags sam gnod sems spong ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bos kyang 'dod chags sam gnod sems spong ngo //
translated: The ordinary man also abandons attachment and malice.

original: sangs rgyas ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtog pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtog pa'o //
translated: The Buddha is included in the Saṅgha.

analyzed: dge 'dun ni 'bras bu chen po 'byung bar byed kyi sangs rgyas ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The Saṅgha is the producer of the great fruit, but the Buddha is not.

original: sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba ni gcig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba ni gcig go //
translated: The liberation of the Buddha and the disciples is the same.

original: gang zag ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang zag ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: The person is not seen.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba 'ba' zhig ni skye ba'i chos cung zad tsam yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho / ba ni med pa nyid do //

translated: Only the mind and mental activities, a mere something, pass from this world to the next.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig ma'o ;
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni skad cig ma'o ;
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.

original: /'du byed rgyas par gyur ba las ni skye ba yin no //
analyzed: /'du byed rgyas par gyur ba las ni skye ba yin no //
translated: From the development of formations, there is birth.

original: 'du byed rnams gnas pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams gnas pa ni med do //
translated: There is no abiding of formations.

original: sems ji lta ba de ltar las yin gyi lus dang ngag gi las ni med do //
analyzed: sems ji lta ba de ltar las yin gyi lus dang ngag gi las ni med do //
translated: Just as there is mind, so there is karma, but there is no bodily or verbal karma.

original: nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos med do //
analyzed: nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos med do //
translated: There is no dharma that does not perish.

original: mchod rten mchod pa la ni 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: mchod rten mchod pa la ni 'bras bu med do //
translated: There is no result from worshiping stupas.

original: da ltar byung ba rtag tu ba ni bag la nyal ba yin @151a * //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rtag tu ba ni bag la nyal ba yin @151a * //
translated: The present is always latent.

original: no ; /'dus byas mthong ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dag ni mang ston pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no //
analyzed: no ; /'dus byas mthong ba'i skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dag ni mang ston pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no //
translated: One enters into the faultless state of seeing conditioned phenomena. These are the fundamental commitments of the Mahāsāṃghikas.

original: yang chos sbas pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni sangs rgyas ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang chos sbas pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni sangs rgyas ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su gtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Next, the fundamental commitment of the Dharmaguptakas is that the Buddha is not included in the Saṅgha.

original: sangs rgyas las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ba de dag dge 'dun las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las 'bras bu chen po 'byung ba de dag dge 'dun las ni ma yin no //
translated: The great result that arises from the Buddha does not arise from the Saṅgha.

original: lha'i gnas na yang tshangs par spyod pa ni yod do //
analyzed: lha'i gnas na yang tshangs par spyod pa ni yod do //
translated: The practice of celibacy exists even in the divine realms.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni yod do zhes bya ba de dag ni chos sbas pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos ni yod do zhes bya ba de dag ni chos sbas pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig yin no //
translated: The worldly dharmas exist. These are the root pledges of the Dharma-concealers.

analyzed: de la 'od srungs pa rnams kyi dam tshig ni rnam par smin pa rnam par smin pa'i chos rnams kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i chos ni yod do //
translated: The pledges of the Kāśmı̄rāvādı̄n are: The dharmas that are subject to karmic ripening exist.

original: spangs la yongs su ma shes pa yod do zhes bya ba dang / chos sbas pa'i thams cad kyang 'dod /
analyzed: spangs la yongs su ma shes pa yod do zhes bya ba dang / chos sbas pa'i thams cad kyang 'dod /
translated: Abandonment is not complete knowledge.

original: de dag ni 'od srungs pa'i dam tshig yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'od srungs pa'i dam tshig yin no //
translated: All of these are the pledges of the Dharma-concealers.

original: gos dmar ba rnams kyi dam tshig ni gang zag ni med do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gos dmar ba rnams kyi dam tshig ni gang zag ni med do zhes bya'o //
translated: The pledges of the Ghosı̄kas are: The person does not exist.

original: yang thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi bye brag slob dpon bla ma'i gzhung ston par byed pa'i 'pho bar smra ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni phung po lnga ni 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: yang thams cad yod par smra ba rnams kyi bye brag slob dpon bla ma'i gzhung ston par byed pa'i 'pho bar smra ba rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni phung po lnga ni 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'pho ba'o //
translated: The root pledges of the Vaibhāsikas, who are a branch of the Sarvāstivāda school and who are the followers of the master Bhadanta, are: The five aggregates are transferred from this world to the next.

original: lam ma rtogs par phung po 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: lam ma rtogs par phung po 'gag pa med do //
translated: The aggregates are not stopped without realizing the path.

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang bcas pa'i phung po ni yod do //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba dang bcas pa'i phung po ni yod do //

original: gang zag ni don dam par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gang zag ni don dam par mi dmigs so //

original: kun kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba de dag ni 'pho ba'i dam tshig yin te /
analyzed: kun kyang mi rtag go zhes bya ba de dag ni 'pho ba'i dam tshig yin te /
translated: Those are the commitments of transference.

analyzed: rnam pa bdun po de lta bu dag tu thams cad yod par smra bar dam tshig dag gnas so //

analyzed: yang gnas ma'i bu'i dam tshig ni nye bar blang ba nye bar len pa dang ldan pa ni btags pa'o //
translated: The commitments of the sons of Vṛṣṇi are that the appropriated and the appropriator are imputed.

original: chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'pho ba med do //
analyzed: chos gang yang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol tu 'pho ba med do //
translated: No phenomenon whatsoever is transferred from this world to the next.

original: gang zag ni phung po lnga nye bar blangs nas 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag ni phung po lnga nye bar blangs nas 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The person is transferred by appropriating the five aggregates.

original: 'dus byas ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni skad cig ma dang skad cig ma ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: Conditioned phenomena are momentary and not momentary.

analyzed: gang zag ni nye bar blangs pa'i phung po nyid dang / gcig pa'am gcig pa ma yin par brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: The person should not be described as the appropriated aggregates or as not being the same as them.

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni chos thams cad dang gcig pa nyid dang tha dad pa nyid du mi brjod do //

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid du mi brjod do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa nyid dam med pa nyid du mi brjod do //
translated: Nirvana is not described as existing or not existing.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang ma yin 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu ba rnams kyi dam tshig nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga'i ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa yang ma yin 'dod chags dang bral ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu ba rnams kyi dam tshig nyid do //
translated: The five collections of consciousness are neither associated with desire nor free from desire.

original: yang gnas ma'i bu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang gnas ma'i bu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Vātsīputrīyas are also of two types:

translated: The root doctrine of the Saṃmitīyas is that there is arising, there is cessation, there is birth, there is death,

translated: that which will be done, that which is done, that which will be cut off, that which is cut off, that which will go, that which goes, that which will be cognized, and that which is cognized exist.

analyzed: yang ri chen po pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: chos mchog pa rnams kyi rtsa ba'i dam tshig ni skye la ma rag pa dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa la ma rag pa dang / 'gag pa'o //
translated: The fundamental doctrine of the Pūrvaśailas is that which is not yet born, that which is born, that which is not yet ceased, and that which is ceased.

original: lam bzangs pa'i yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lam bzangs pa'i yang de bzhin no //
translated: The Aparaśailas are the same.

analyzed: grong khyer drug pa la kha cig na re ri chen po pa'i bye brag yin zer /

analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa ni /
translated: Others say

analyzed: mang pos bkur ba pa'i bye brag yin par 'dod de /

analyzed: de ltar de rnams ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa rnam pa bzhir gnas pa yin no //

translated: These four schools are divided into eighteen schools by following the masters.

original: de dag ni rtsa ba'i rtog pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni rtsa ba'i rtog pa dag yin no //

analyzed: gzhan nang gses kyi dbye ba ni mang du yod pas brjod par bya'o //
translated: There are many other divisions, but they will not be described here.

original: ci lta zhe na ;
analyzed: ci lta zhe na ;

translated: The Vaibhāṣikas are divided into four schools by their differences in belief and scripture: the Dārṣṭāntikas, Sautrāntikas, Vibhajyavādins, and Sarvāstivādins.

original: de la dang po dngos po gzhan nyid du 'gyur pa ni btsun pa chos skyob kyi ste /
analyzed: de la dang po dngos po gzhan nyid du 'gyur pa ni btsun pa chos skyob kyi ste /

analyzed: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na / dngos po gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: The Mahīśāsakas are so called because they follow the Mahīśāsakas.🔽The second, the Sautrāntikas, are divided into two schools: the Sarvāstivādins and the Vibhajyavādins.🔽The Sarvāstivādins are so called because they assert that everything exists.

original: rdzas gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: The Vibhajyavādins are so called because they assert that some things exist and some do not.🔽The third, the Vibhajyavādins, are divided into two schools: the Mahāsāṃghikas and the Sthaviras.🔽The Mahāsāṃghikas are so called because they are the majority.🔽The Sthaviras are so called because they are the elders.🔽The fourth, the Sarvāstivādins, are divided into two schools: the Vātsīputrīyas and the Sarvāstivādins.🔽The Vātsīputrīyas are so called because they follow Vātsīputra.🔽The Sarvāstivādins are so called because they assert that everything exists.

original: gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byas pa na dbyibs gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin gyi rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gser gyi snod bcom nas gzhan du byas pa na dbyibs gzhan du gyur pa nyid yin gyi rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When a golden pot is destroyed and made into something else, its shape changes, but its substance does not change.

original: ji ltar 'o ma la zhor gyur pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'o ma la zhor gyur pa na /
translated: When milk turns into curd,

translated: its taste, potency and ripening change, but not its color. In the same way, when phenomena occur from the past to the present,

analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi dngos po nyams pa yin gyi rdzas ni ma yin no //
translated: the state of the past is lost, but not the substance.

original: de bzhin du da ltar gyi dus nas ma 'ongs par 'gyur ba na yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du da ltar gyi dus nas ma 'ongs par 'gyur ba na yang /
translated: In the same way, when the present becomes the future,

analyzed: da ltar gyi dngos po nyams pa yin gyi rdzas kyi dngos po ni ma yin no zhes zer ro//
translated: the state of the present is lost, but not the substance.

analyzed: @152a * // mtshan nyid gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa dbyangs sgrogs kyi ste /

original: de na re chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de na re chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na /
translated: He says that when phenomena are engaged by time,

original: 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'das pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar gyi mtshan nyid dang mi ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is that which possesses the characteristic of the past devoid of the characteristics of the future and present.

original: ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi ngag dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang ma 'ongs pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa ni 'das pa dang da ltar gyi ngag dang mi ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is that which possesses the characteristic of the future devoid of the characteristics of the past and present.

original: dper na skyes bu bud med gcig la chags par gyur pa na /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu bud med gcig la chags par gyur pa na /
translated: For example, when a man is attached to one woman,

original: lhag ma rnams la chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la chags pa dang bral ba ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: he is not detached from other women.

original: gnas skabs su gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa dbyig bshes kyi ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs su gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa dbyig bshes kyi ste /
translated: Bhadanta Vasumitra says: It is a transformation of state.

original: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na gzhan dang gzhan du rjod par byed pa ni gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na gzhan dang gzhan du rjod par byed pa ni gnas skabs gzhan du gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: When phenomena enter into the future, etc., they are said to be different, but they are a transformation of state,

original: rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not a transformation of substance.

original: dper na sdong bu gcig pu bgrang ba'i tshe ni gcig ces brjod par gyur pa la /
analyzed: dper na sdong bu gcig pu bgrang ba'i tshe ni gcig ces brjod par gyur pa la /
translated: For example, when one counts a single stick, it is called one.

original: grangs brgyar gtogs pa'i tshe ni brgya zhes bya //
analyzed: grangs brgyar gtogs pa'i tshe ni brgya zhes bya //
translated: When it is a matter of a hundred, it is called a hundred.

original: grangs stong du bgrang ba'i tshe ni stong zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: grangs stong du bgrang ba'i tshe ni stong zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: When it is a matter of a thousand, it is called a thousand.

original: gzhan gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i ste /
analyzed: gzhan gzhan du gyur pa ni btsun pa sangs rgyas lha'i ste /
translated: According to the Bhadanta, the transformation of the object is the transformation of the object-field.

original: de ni chos rnams su dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na sngon dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni chos rnams su dus kyis 'jug par gyur pa na sngon dang phyi ma la ltos nas gzhan dang gzhan du brjod par bya ste /
translated: When the object-field is engaged in the factors, it is called other in relation to the past and the future.

original: dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang brjod /
analyzed: dper na bud med gcig la ma zhes kyang brjod /
translated: For example, the same woman is called mother and daughter.

original: bu mo zhes kyang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bu mo zhes kyang brjod pa yin no //
translated: She is called mother in relation to her daughter, and daughter in relation to her mother.

original: bzhi po de dag ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad yod ces smra ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ji lta ba bzhin du thams cad yod ces smra ba'i phyir thams cad yod par smra ba'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the Sautrāntikas are right in saying that the object-field is the transformation of the object, but wrong in saying that the object-field is not the object.🔽According to the Bhadanta, the object-field is the transformation of the object and the object.

original: de bzhin du kha cig rkyen bdun te /
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig rkyen bdun te /
translated: The Bhadanta says that there are seven conditions:

original: rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / bdag po dang / las dang / zas dang / rten zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: rgyu dang / dmigs pa dang / de ma thag pa dang / bdag po dang / las dang / zas dang / rten zhes bya'o ;
translated: cause, object-support, dominance, antecedent, nature, service, and support.

original: / de bzhin dul la ni rtogs pa'i sems bzhi ste /
analyzed: / de bzhin dul la ni rtogs pa'i sems bzhi ste /
translated: According to the Bhadanta, there are four types of understanding:

original: bden pa so so pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa so so pa'o //
translated: understanding of the truths taken one by one, understanding of the truths taken two by two, understanding of the truths taken three by three, and understanding of the truths taken four by four.

original: gzhan rnams ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa brgyad yin te /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa brgyad yin te /
translated: The others are the eight knowledges of Dharma and subsequent knowledge.

original: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni ma yin no zhes zer /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i ye shes ni ma yin no zhes zer /
translated: They are not the knowledge of the conventional.

original: gzhan rnams ni bcu gnyis su 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni bcu gnyis su 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that there are twelve.

original: de las kyang gzhan pa rnams ni bcu drug tu 'dod do //
analyzed: de las kyang gzhan pa rnams ni bcu drug tu 'dod do //
translated: Others assert that there are sixteen.

original: de bzhin du sems med pa'i gnyid la ni sems ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems med pa'i gnyid la ni sems ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, sleep that is not associated with mind does not have it.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa lhag ma rnams la ni yod do //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa lhag ma rnams la ni yod do //
translated: It exists in the remaining associated states.

original: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni yod do //
analyzed: 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa ni yod do //
translated: The meditative attainment of the cessation of discriminations and feelings has the cessation of discriminations and feelings.

original: lhag ma rnams la ni mtshungs par ldan pa yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams la ni mtshungs par ldan pa yod do //
translated: It exists in the remaining associated states.

original: ji ltar yid kyis @152b skyo bar gyur pa ni spyod pa med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyis @152b skyo bar gyur pa ni spyod pa med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: When the mind is wearied by the mind, one enters meditative attainment in the formless realm.

original: dga' bas skyo bar gyur pa ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug bzhin du 'du shes pa dang / tshor bas skyo bar gyur pa ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: dga' bas skyo bar gyur pa ni dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug bzhin du 'du shes pa dang / tshor bas skyo bar gyur pa ni 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: One is wearied by ideation and sensation when one enters into the attainment of the cessation of ideation and sensation.

original: de bzhin du kha cig na re sems kyis yul gyi khyad par thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha cig na re sems kyis yul gyi khyad par thob pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: In the same way, some say that the attainment of nirvana is the acquisition of a special object by the mind.

original: la la na re phung po med par gyur par mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi dngos po'i don ni ma yin zhes zer /
analyzed: la la na re phung po med par gyur par mya ngan las 'das pa yin gyi dngos po'i don ni ma yin zhes zer /
translated: Some say that nirvana is the non-existence of the aggregates, not a real entity.

original: kha cig na re rang bzhin gyis lung du bstan du med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig na re rang bzhin gyis lung du bstan du med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say that nirvana is the inexpressible by nature.

original: de bzhin du la la na re tshad med pa rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin no yang zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du la la na re tshad med pa rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag yin no yang zer ro //
translated: In the same way, some say that the immeasurables are the factors of enlightenment.

original: kha cig na re 'bras bu che ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'bras bu che ba ni gsum ste /
translated: Some say that the great fruit is the three:

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / tshad med pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi 'bras bu dang / 'bras bu che ba dang / tshad med pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the result of the mind of another, the great result, the immeasurable result.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro bar 'gro ba na grogs su gyur pa ni las yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'gro bar 'gro ba na grogs su gyur pa ni las yin no //
translated: In the same way, action is the companion of beings who go to the plane of existence by the power of the defilements.

original: de bzhin du de spangs par gyur pa ni 'gro ba de dag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du de spangs par gyur pa ni 'gro ba de dag tu 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when the defilements are abandoned, beings no longer go to the planes of existence.

original: yang la la na re sngar byas pa'i las rnams kyi dbang gis dang por 'gro bar 'dod do //
analyzed: yang la la na re sngar byas pa'i las rnams kyi dbang gis dang por 'gro bar 'dod do //
translated: Some say that beings go to the planes of existence by the power of actions accomplished previously.

original: kha cig ni ji ltar goms pa'i las rnams kyis yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni ji ltar goms pa'i las rnams kyis yin par 'dod do //
translated: Others say that it is by the power of actions accomplished in the present life.

original: la lan re rnam pa lngas goms pas te /
analyzed: la lan re rnam pa lngas goms pas te /
translated: Still others say that it is by the power of the five types of actions:

original: snga ma bzhi dang rkyen gyi khyad par goms pas so //
analyzed: snga ma bzhi dang rkyen gyi khyad par goms pas so //
translated: the four previous types of actions and the power of the repetition of the conditions.

original: kha cig na re 'das pa'i nye bar len pa las me 'bar ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'das pa'i nye bar len pa las me 'bar ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the fire of the plane of burning arises from the grasping of the past.

original: kha cig na re da ltar gyi las so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re da ltar gyi las so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that it arises from the actions of the present.

original: kha cig na re sgrib pa lnga po rnams las gang yang rung ba la mi mthun par sems pa las so zhes zer /
analyzed: kha cig na re sgrib pa lnga po rnams las gang yang rung ba la mi mthun par sems pa las so zhes zer /
translated: Some say: It is produced from the mind that is not in agreement with any of the five hindrances.

original: kha cig ni gzugs kyi khams ni khams bzhi par kha dog bzhi par 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs kyi khams ni khams bzhi par kha dog bzhi par 'dod do //
translated: Some say: The form realm is four elements and four colors.

original: gzhan ni kha dog gcig par 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan ni kha dog gcig par 'dod do //
translated: Others say: It is one color.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag ni gang zag ni yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag ni gang zag ni yod do //
translated: Similarly, others say: The person exists.

original: de yang phung po las gzhan yin no zhes zer /
analyzed: de yang phung po las gzhan yin no zhes zer /
translated: And it is different from the aggregates.

original: phung po tsam yang ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po tsam yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the aggregates,

original: phung po nye bar blangs pa dang ldan par brtag pa'o //
analyzed: phung po nye bar blangs pa dang ldan par brtag pa'o //
translated: because it is conceived as possessing the appropriated aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas so //
translated: Nirvana is without appropriation.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las rim gyis brtags nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las rim gyis brtags nas mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one realizes the four noble truths in order,

original: bar ma dor mi mthun pa'i sems 'byung ba med do //🔽sdug @153a * //
analyzed: bar ma dor mi mthun pa'i sems 'byung ba med do // sdug @153a * //
translated: and there is no arising of a different mind in between.

original: bsngal la dmigs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gis skyon med par 'jug go //
analyzed: bsngal la dmigs pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag gis skyon med par 'jug go //
translated: One enters into the faultless state by means of the enlightenment factor of investigating phenomena that focuses on the truth of suffering.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'du byed mi rtag par yid la byed pa la brten pa'i sems bcu gsum gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'du byed mi rtag par yid la byed pa la brten pa'i sems bcu gsum gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: The result of stream-enterer is attained by means of thirteen thoughts, which are based on the contemplation of the impermanence of the formations belonging to the realm of desire.

original: chos de la gnas pa la nyams pa med do //
analyzed: chos de la gnas pa la nyams pa med do //
translated: One who abides in this Dharma does not retrogress.

original: de bzhin du zhugs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhugs pa yang ngo //
translated: One who has entered this stream does not retrogress.

original: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
translated: The perfected being can retrogress.

original: srid pa bar ma do yang yod do //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma do yang yod do //
translated: The intermediate existence exists.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang yod do //
translated: The past and the future exist.

original: gcig tu dge ba'i chos kyi don mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod do //
analyzed: gcig tu dge ba'i chos kyi don mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod do //
translated: Nirvana, which is the object of the wholesome factors, exists.

original: phung po 'gag pa ni dus las rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: phung po 'gag pa ni dus las rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: The cessation of the aggregates is liberation from time.

original: lha la yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yod do //
analyzed: lha la yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa yod do //
translated: The practice of pure conduct exists among the gods.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas skyon med pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One can enter into the absence of faults from the realm of desire.

original: so so'i skye bos kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems spong ngo //
analyzed: so so'i skye bos kyang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gnod sems spong ngo //
translated: An ordinary man can abandon desire and malice.

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am bral ba yang ma yin te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa'am bral ba yang ma yin te rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five sensory consciousnesses are neither associated with attachment nor free from attachment, because they are devoid of conceptualization.

original: drug pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin no //
translated: The sixth consciousness is both associated with attachment and free from attachment.

original: dgra bcom pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang sems kyis zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa las dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs dang sems kyis zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa las dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The Arhat is the object of the pure and impure form and mind of the person with impurities.

original: sems kyis yul gzhan du phyin pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sems kyis yul gzhan du phyin pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The mind does not go to the object.

original: 'di na gnas bzhin du thag ring po na gnas pa la dmigs par byed do //
analyzed: 'di na gnas bzhin du thag ring po na gnas pa la dmigs par byed do //
translated: While remaining here, it takes as its object a distant object.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na gzugs med do //
translated: There is no form in the formless realm.

original: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la yang nyams pa'i chos yod do //
translated: The Arhat has the nature of regression.

original: dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod do //
analyzed: dus ma yin par 'chi ba yod do //
translated: There is untimely death.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa yod do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa yod do //
translated: There is human effort.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba yod do //
translated: There is mundane right view.

original: phyi rol pa la yang mngon par shes pa lnga yod do //
analyzed: phyi rol pa la yang mngon par shes pa lnga yod do //
translated: The outsiders have the five superknowledges.

original: dgra bcom pa la gzhan gyis bstan cing bsgrub pa med do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa la gzhan gyis bstan cing bsgrub pa med do //
translated: The Arhats do not have a teacher, nor do they have a companion.

original: mi shes pa med do //
analyzed: mi shes pa med do //
translated: They do not have ignorance,

original: yid gnyis med do //
analyzed: yid gnyis med do //
translated: nor do they have doubt,

original: gzhan gyi la yongs su brtag pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi la yongs su brtag pa med do //
translated: nor do they have any investigation of others.

original: ngag 'jug pa'i smra ba med do /
analyzed: ngag 'jug pa'i smra ba med do /
translated: They do not have speech that is not in accord with the truth.

original: dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang stobs dang byang chub kyi yan lag bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have generated the faculties, the powers, and the factors of enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / bdud ris dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can du skye ba ni med do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos rnams byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / bdud ris dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can du skye ba ni med do //
translated: The disciples of the Bhagavān do not take birth in Uttarakuru, among the gods without perception, or among the gods of the class of the mindless.

original: rgyun du zhugs pas bsam gtan rnams thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pas bsam gtan rnams thob pa ma yin no //
translated: The stream-enterers do not obtain the meditative absorptions.

original: mdo sde thams cad ni nges pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde thams cad ni nges pa'i don yin no //
translated: All sūtras are of definitive meaning.

original: mtshungs par @153b mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal dang sems las byung ba'i bag la nyal yang yod do //
analyzed: mtshungs par @153b mi ldan pa'i bag la nyal dang sems las byung ba'i bag la nyal yang yod do //
translated: There are also latent tendencies that are not concomitant and latent tendencies that are mental factors.

original: 'dus byas ni skad cig ma dang / skad cig ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: 'dus byas ni skad cig ma dang / skad cig ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There are also conditioned phenomena that are momentary and not momentary.

original: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i nye bar len pa las me 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur ba'i nye bar len pa las me 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Fire burns due to the appropriation that is about to cease.

original: sems can gcig cig 'chi zhing skye bo mi shes pa'i gzhi las 'chi ba'i mthar thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: sems can gcig cig 'chi zhing skye bo mi shes pa'i gzhi las 'chi ba'i mthar thug gi bar du'o //
translated: One being dies and is reborn, and this is the basis of ignorance, up to the end of death.

original: 'chi ba'i rkyen byed pa'i sems gcig po de nyid yang dag par zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i rkyen byed pa'i sems gcig po de nyid yang dag par zhi bar bya'o //
translated: One should completely pacify that very thought which is the condition for death.

original: tshad med pa rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams ni byang chub kyi yan lag ma yin no //
translated: The immeasurables are not the factors of enlightenment.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa drug cu rtsa bdun grub par byas nas snyoms par 'jug pa bcu dgu dang ; dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams byang chub sems dpas yang dag par sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa drug cu rtsa bdun grub par byas nas snyoms par 'jug pa bcu dgu dang ; dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams byang chub sems dpas yang dag par sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Having accomplished the sixty-seven meditative absorptions, the bodhisattva cultivates the nineteen meditative absorptions, the faculties, the powers, and the factors of enlightenment.

original: kun du sbyor ba rnams ma gtogs pa nyid ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba rnams ma gtogs pa nyid ni bar chad med pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: Except for the fetters, those to be abandoned by the uninterrupted path.

original: 'gro ba dang bcas pa'i lam ni nges par gnyis nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang bcas pa'i lam ni nges par gnyis nyid yin no //
translated: The path with going is definitely twofold.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni rim gyis thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni rim gyis thob pa ma yin no //
translated: The fruit of the spiritual practitioner is not attained gradually.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon du byed do //
translated: The worldly path also realizes the fruit of once-returner and the fruit of non-returner.

original: 'khor ba gzhan du 'gyur ba yang yod do //
analyzed: 'khor ba gzhan du 'gyur ba yang yod do //
translated: There is also a transformation of the life-cycle.

original: chos cung zhig kyang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: chos cung zhig kyang 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro ba med do //
translated: Nothing whatsoever passes from this world to the next.

original: phung po nye bar blangs nas sems can ni 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po nye bar blangs nas sems can ni 'pho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The sentient being passes on, taking up a new set of aggregates.

original: gzugs kyi khams ni kha dog bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams ni kha dog bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The form realm has four colors.

original: de bzhin du srid pa bar ma ni kha dog bcu'am nya phyis kyi mdog 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa bar ma ni kha dog bcu'am nya phyis kyi mdog 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Similarly, the intermediate existence has ten colors or the color of a mother-of-pearl.

original: de bzhin du srid pa bar ma ni zhag lnga'am bdun du gnas pa'am yun ring por yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa bar ma ni zhag lnga'am bdun du gnas pa'am yun ring por yang ngo //
translated: Similarly, the intermediate existence lasts for five or seven days or a long time.

original: de bzhin du las ni nam yang med par mi 'gyur ro //🔽nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du las ni nam yang med par mi 'gyur ro // nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, action never becomes nonexistent.🔽It does not perish.

original: 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phrogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not carried off.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: There is no experience of the ripening of action.

original: srid pa ji srid kyi bar du rigs kyi ngo bo dang lhan cig tu gnas so ;
analyzed: srid pa ji srid kyi bar du rigs kyi ngo bo dang lhan cig tu gnas so ;
translated: And it remains together with the essence of the family until the end of cyclic existence.

original: / sngar nye bar bsags pa dang phyis nye bar bsags pa'i las kyi rkyen nye bar rnyed par gyur nas 'gro ba rnams su 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: / sngar nye bar bsags pa dang phyis nye bar bsags pa'i las kyi rkyen nye bar rnyed par gyur nas 'gro ba rnams su 'gro bar byed do //
translated: When the conditions of karma accumulated earlier and later are met, it causes beings to go to the various destinies.

original: nges pa'i las nas bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: nges pa'i las nas bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: And it cannot be turned back from its definite karma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni skyes bu'i gzugs kyis lhums su zhugs pa yin /🔽yum gyi dku nas glang po @154a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni skyes bu'i gzugs kyis lhums su zhugs pa yin / yum gyi dku nas glang po @154a * //
translated: The bodhisattva enters the womb in the form of a human being.

original: cher gyur nas zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cher gyur nas zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: He does not enter the womb as an elephant🔽and then emerge from the womb as a human being.

original: de ni de'i rmi lam gyi rnam rtog yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i rmi lam gyi rnam rtog yin no //
translated: That is a dream-like conception of the bodhisattva.

original: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / ltar ltar po'i ngo bor yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nur nur po dang / mer mer po dang / ltar ltar po'i ngo bor yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He also becomes an embryo, a fetus, and a newborn infant.

original: skye gnas na yang sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye gnas na yang sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i nus pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: And even in the womb, he has the power of unobstructed liberation.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes ni longs spyod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ye shes ni longs spyod pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The wisdom of the blessed buddhas enters into him.

original: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang sems gcig gis 'gog go //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid kyang sems gcig gis 'gog go //
translated: The state of ordinary worldling is also stopped by a single thought.

original: sems gcig gis sgrib pa thams cad spong /
analyzed: sems gcig gis sgrib pa thams cad spong /
translated: All the obscurations are abandoned by a single thought.

original: sems gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa yang rab tu thob bo //
analyzed: sems gcig gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa yang rab tu thob bo //
translated: And by a single thought, one attains the liberation of the omniscient one, which is free from obscurations.

original: sems gcig gis zhugs pa'i chos rnams 'gag par byed cing 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: sems gcig gis zhugs pa'i chos rnams 'gag par byed cing 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: By a single thought, the factors conducive to penetration cease and the factors conducive to the fruit arise.

original: rkyen bzhi nyid kyis rkyen thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: rkyen bzhi nyid kyis rkyen thams cad bsdus so //
translated: All conditions are included in the four conditions.

original: sdug bsngal gyis spang bar bya ba'i kun nas ldang ba la gnas pa ni mtshams med pa dag byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis spang bar bya ba'i kun nas ldang ba la gnas pa ni mtshams med pa dag byed pa yin gyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Those who are established in the defilements to be abandoned by the path of seeing commit the five heinous actions, but not others.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal bzhis bsdus pas thams cad bsdus pa ste des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcod par byed kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bag la nyal bzhis bsdus pas thams cad bsdus pa ste des dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad gcod par byed kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya bas ni ma yin no //
translated: All are included in the four latent afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing, which sever all roots of virtue, but not those to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin thams cad la 'jig rten ji srid gnas kyi bar du gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa'i 'bad pas gnod par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rang bzhin thams cad la 'jig rten ji srid gnas kyi bar du gzhan gyis gnod par byed pa'i 'bad pas gnod par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The nature of meditation is such that until the end of the world, it cannot be harmed by the efforts of others.

original: bdag nyid kyi tshe zad pas dus byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi tshe zad pas dus byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: It ends only through the exhaustion of one’s own life.

original: dgra bcom pa thams cad ni 'bral bas 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa thams cad ni 'bral bas 'chi bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: All arhats die through separation.

original: 'pho bas ni 'chi ba med de /🔽ji skad du lus dang bral bas dus byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'pho bas ni 'chi ba med de / ji skad du lus dang bral bas dus byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They do not die through transference.🔽As it is said, “They die through separation from the body.”

original: dgra bcom pa ni lus tha ma dang bral bas 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni lus tha ma dang bral bas 'bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: Arhats die through separation from the final body.

original: lus ni 'dir dbang po'i lus la bya bar bzhed do //
analyzed: lus ni 'dir dbang po'i lus la bya bar bzhed do //
translated: Here, the body refers to the body of the sense faculties.

translated: All feelings arise from karma.

analyzed: sngar byas pa'i sgom pas spang bar bya ba'i las thams cad kyi rnam par smin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar rnams so /
